us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.interfaces

Interface FrameLine3DBasics

  • All Superinterfaces:
    us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, FixedFrameLine3DBasics, FrameChangeable, FrameLine3DReadOnly, Line3DBasics, Line3DReadOnly, ReferenceFrameHolder, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FrameLine3D

    public interface FrameLine3DBasics
extends FixedFrameLine3DBasics, FrameChangeable
    Write and read interface for a line 3D expressed in a changeable reference frame, i.e. the reference frame in which this line is expressed can be changed.

    A line 3D represents an infinitely long line in the XY-plane and defined by a point and a direction.

    In addition to representing a Line3DBasics, a ReferenceFrame is associated to a FrameLine3DBasics. This allows, for instance, to enforce, at runtime, that operations on lines occur in the same coordinate system.

    Because a FrameLine3DBasics extends Line3DBasics, it is compatible with methods only requiring Line3DBasics. However, these methods do NOT assert that the operation occur in the proper coordinate system. Use this feature carefully and always prefer using methods requiring FrameLine3DBasics.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the new reference frame for this frame line 3D.

      • setToZero

        default void setToZero(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame)
        Sets the point and direction parts of this line 3D to zero and sets the current reference frame to referenceFrame.
        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the new reference frame to be associated with this line 3D.

      • setIncludingFrame

        default void setIncludingFrame(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame,
                               double pointOnLineX,
                               double pointOnLineY,
                               double pointOnLineZ,
                               double lineDirectionX,
                               double lineDirectionY,
                               double lineDirectionZ)
        Redefines this line with a new point, a new direction vector, and a new reference frame.
        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the new reference frame for this frame line.
        pointOnLineX - the new x-coordinate of the point on this line.
        pointOnLineY - the new y-coordinate of the point on this line.
        pointOnLineZ - the new z-coordinate of the point on this line.
        lineDirectionX - the new x-component of the direction of this line.
        lineDirectionY - the new y-component of the direction of this line.
        lineDirectionZ - the new z-component of the direction of this line.

        After calling this method this line is in the XY-plane.

        Parameters:

        lineDirection - new direction of this line. Not modified.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if pointOnLine and lineDirection are not expressed in the same reference frame
